drug.name: Succinic acid
drug.description: A water-soluble, colorless crystal with an acid taste that is used as a chemical intermediate, in medicine, the manufacture of lacquers, and to make perfume esters. It is also used in foods as a sequestrant, buffer, and a neutralizing agent. (Hawley's Condensed Chemical Dictionary, 12th ed, p1099; McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 4th ed, p1851)
drug.synthesis-reference: Michael Diamantoglou, Gerhard Meyer, "Process for the production of water-insoluble fibers of cellulose monoesters of maleic acid, succinic acid and phthalic acid, having an extremely high absorbability for water and physiological liquids." U.S. Patent US4734239, issued April, 1941.
drug.indication: For nutritional supplementation, also for treating dietary shortage or imbalance
drug.mechanism-of-action: Succinate is an essential component of the Krebs or citric acid cycle and serves an electron donor in the production of fumaric acid and FADH2. It also has been shown to be a good "natural" antibiotic because of its relative acidic or caustic nature (high concentrations can even cause burns). Succinate supplements have been shown to help reduce the effects of hangovers by activating the degradation of acetaldehyde - a toxic byproduct of alcohol metabolism - into CO2 and H2O through aerobic metabolism. Succinic acid has been shown to stimulate neural system recovery and bolster the immune system. Claims have also been made that it boosts awareness, concentration and reflexes.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as dicarboxylic acids and derivatives. These are organic compounds containing exactly two carboxylic acid groups.

product.name: Iron Aspartate Glycinate and Polysaccharide Complex, Ascorbic Calcium, Vitamin B12, Folic Acid, Calcium Threonate and Succinic Acid

Blood. 2007 Apr 15;109(8):3260-9. Epub 2006 Dec 27.

Popov VN, Eprintsev AT, Fedorin DN, Fomenko OIu, Igamberdiev AU: [Role of transamination in the mobilization of respiratory substrates in germinating seeds of castor oil plants]. Prikl Biokhim Mikrobiol. 2007 May-Jun;43(3):376-81.
Wang C, Zhang HB, Wang LH, Zhang LH: Succinic semialdehyde couples stress response to quorum-sensing signal decay in Agrobacterium tumefaciens. Mol Microbiol. 2006 Oct;62(1):45-56. Epub 2006 Aug 30.
Ahn SJ, Yang CH, Cooksey DA: Pseudomonas putida 06909 genes expressed during colonization on mycelial surfaces and phenotypic characterization of mutants. J Appl Microbiol. 2007 Jul;103(1):120-32.
Chiribau CB, Mihasan M, Ganas P, Igloi GL, Artenie V, Brandsch R: Final steps in the catabolism of nicotine. FEBS J. 2006 Apr;273(7):1528-36.
Chen X, Ji ZL, Chen YZ: TTD: Therapeutic Target Database. Nucleic Acids Res. 2002 Jan 1;30(1):412-5.

polypeptide.name: Succinate-semialdehyde dehydrogenase, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes one step in the degradation of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA).

enzyme.name: Succinate dehydrogenase cytochrome b560 subunit, mitochondrial

article.citation: Rutter J, Winge DR, Schiffman JD: Succinate dehydrogenase - Assembly, regulation and role in human disease. Mitochondrion. 2010 Jun;10(4):393-401. doi: 10.1016/j.mito.2010.03.001. Epub 2010 Mar 10.

Bayley JP, Devilee P, Taschner PE: The SDH mutation database: an online resource for succinate dehydrogenase sequence variants involved in pheochromocytoma, paraganglioma and mitochondrial complex II deficiency. BMC Med Genet. 2005 Nov 16;6:39.

Szeto SS, Reinke SN, Sykes BD, Lemire BD: Ubiquinone-binding site mutations in the Saccharomyces cerevisiae succinate dehydrogenase generate superoxide and lead to the accumulation of succinate. J Biol Chem. 2007 Sep 14;282(37):27518-26. Epub 2007 Jul 18.

polypeptide.name: Succinate dehydrogenase cytochrome b560 subunit, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Membrane-anchoring subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) that is involved in complex II of the mitochondrial electron transport chain and is responsible for transferring electrons from succinate to ubiquinone (coenzyme Q).

synonyms.synonym: Succinate-ubiquinone oxidoreductase cytochrome B large subunit

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, succinate dehydrogenase complex (ubiquinone)
mitochondrial electron transport, succinate to ubiquinone

article.citation: Maklashina E, Iverson TM, Sher Y, Kotlyar V, Andrell J, Mirza O, Hudson JM, Armstrong FA, Rothery RA, Weiner JH, Cecchini G: Fumarate reductase and succinate oxidase activity of Escherichia coli complex II homologs are perturbed differently by mutation of the flavin binding domain. J Biol Chem. 2006 Apr 21;281(16):11357-65. Epub 2006 Feb 15.

Takeo S, Kokaze A, Ng CS, Mizuchi D, Watanabe JI, Tanabe K, Kojima S, Kita K: Succinate dehydrogenase in Plasmodium falciparum mitochondria: molecular characterization of the SDHA and SDHB genes for the catalytic subunits, the flavoprotein (Fp) and iron-sulfur (Ip) subunits. Mol Biochem Parasitol. 2000 Apr 15;107(2):191-205.
Ackrell BA: Cytopathies involving mitochondrial complex II. Mol Aspects Med. 2002 Oct;23(5):369-84.

polypeptide.name: Succinate dehydrogenase [ubiquinone] flavoprotein subunit, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Flavoprotein (FP) subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) that is involved in complex II of the mitochondrial electron transport chain and is responsible for transferring electrons from succinate to ubiquinone (coenzyme Q). Can act as a tumor suppressor.

go-classifier.description: mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, succinate dehydrogenase complex (ubiquinone)

article.citation: Majumdar R, Guest JR, Bridger WA: Functional consequences of substitution of the active site (phospho)histidine residue of Escherichia coli succinyl-CoA synthetase. Biochim Biophys Acta. 1991 Jan 8;1076(1):86-90. doi: 10.1016/0167-4838(91)90223-m.

Van Hove JL, Saenz MS, Thomas JA, Gallagher RC, Lovell MA, Fenton LZ, Shanske S, Myers SM, Wanders RJ, Ruiter J, Turkenburg M, Waterham HR: Succinyl-CoA ligase deficiency: a mitochondrial hepatoencephalomyopathy. Pediatr Res. 2010 Aug;68(2):159-64. doi: 10.1203/00006450-201011001-00310.

polypeptide.name: Succinyl-CoA ligase [GDP-forming] subunit beta, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the GTP-dependent ligation of succinate and CoA to form succinyl-CoA.

article.citation: Gorres KL, Raines RT: Prolyl 4-hydroxylase. Crit Rev Biochem Mol Biol. 2010 Apr;45(2):106-24. doi: 10.3109/10409231003627991.

polypeptide.name: Prolyl 4-hydroxylase subunit alpha-1
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the post-translational formation of 4-hydroxyproline in -Xaa-Pro-Gly- sequences in collagens and other proteins.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on single donors with incorporation of molecular oxygen, incorporation of two atoms of oxygen

polypeptide.name: Prolyl 4-hydroxylase subunit alpha-2
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the post-translational formation of 4-hydroxyproline in -Xaa-Pro-Gly- sequences in collagens and other proteins.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on single donors with incorporation of molecular oxygen, incorporation of two atoms of oxygen

article.citation: Guo HF, Cho EJ, Devkota AK, Chen Y, Russell W, Phillips GN Jr, Yamauchi M, Dalby KN, Kurie JM: A scalable lysyl hydroxylase 2 expression system and luciferase-based enzymatic activity assay. Arch Biochem Biophys. 2017 Mar 15;618:45-51. doi: 10.1016/j.abb.2017.02.003. Epub 2017 Feb 20.

polypeptide.name: Procollagen-lysine,2-oxoglutarate 5-dioxygenase 3
polypeptide.specific-function: Forms hydroxylysine residues in -Xaa-Lys-Gly- sequences in collagens. These hydroxylysines serve as sites of attachment for carbohydrate units and are essential for the stability of the intermolecular collagen cross-links.

article.citation: Place TL, Domann FE: Prolyl-hydroxylase 3: Evolving Roles for an Ancient Signaling Protein. Hypoxia (Auckl). 2013 Oct 1;2013(1):13-17. doi: 10.2147/HP.S50091.

polypeptide.name: Prolyl 3-hydroxylase 1
polypeptide.specific-function: Basement membrane-associated chondroitin sulfate proteoglycan (CSPG). Has prolyl 3-hydroxylase activity catalyzing the post-translational formation of 3-hydroxyproline in -Xaa-Pro-Gly- sequences in collagens, especially types IV and V. May be involved in the secretory pathway of cells. Has growth suppressive activity in fibroblasts.

go-classifier.description: negative regulation of post-translational protein modification

article.citation: Place TL, Domann FE: Prolyl-hydroxylase 3: Evolving Roles for an Ancient Signaling Protein. Hypoxia (Auckl). 2013 Oct 1;2013(1):13-17. doi: 10.2147/HP.S50091.

polypeptide.name: Prolyl 3-hydroxylase 2
polypeptide.specific-function: Shows prolyl 3-hydroxylase activity catalyzing the post-translational formation of 3-hydroxyproline in -Xaa-Pro-Gly-sequences in collagens, especially types II, IV and V.

article.citation: Place TL, Domann FE: Prolyl-hydroxylase 3: Evolving Roles for an Ancient Signaling Protein. Hypoxia (Auckl). 2013 Oct 1;2013(1):13-17. doi: 10.2147/HP.S50091.

polypeptide.name: Prolyl 3-hydroxylase 3
polypeptide.specific-function: Has prolyl 3-hydroxylase activity catalyzing the post-translational formation of 3-hydroxyproline in -Xaa-Pro-Gly-sequences in collagens, especially types IV and V.

article.citation: Coros AM, Swenson L, Wolodko WT, Fraser ME: Structure of the CoA transferase from pig heart to 1.7 A resolution. Acta Crystallogr D Biol Crystallogr. 2004 Oct;60(Pt 10):1717-25. Epub 2004 Sep 23.

polypeptide.name: Succinyl-CoA:3-ketoacid coenzyme A transferase 1, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Key enzyme for ketone body catabolism. Transfers the CoA moiety from succinate to acetoacetate. Formation of the enzyme-CoA intermediate proceeds via an unstable anhydride species formed between the carboxylate groups of the enzyme and substrate.

go-classifier.description: positive regulation of insulin secretion involved in cellular response to glucose stimulus

article.citation: Lahousse SA, Carter JJ, Xu XJ, Wands JR, de la Monte SM: Differential growth factor regulation of aspartyl-(asparaginyl)-beta-hydroxylase family genes in SH-Sy5y human neuroblastoma cells. BMC Cell Biol. 2006 Dec 7;7:41. doi: 10.1186/1471-2121-7-41.

polypeptide.name: Aspartyl/asparaginyl beta-hydroxylase
polypeptide.specific-function: Isoform 1: specifically hydroxylates an Asp or Asn residue in certain epidermal growth factor-like (EGF) domains of a number of proteins.Isoform 8: membrane-bound Ca(2+)-sensing protein, which is a structural component of the ER-plasma membrane junctions. Isoform 8 regulates the activity of Ca(+2) released-activated Ca(+2) (CRAC) channels in T-cells.

go-classifier.description: integral component of endoplasmic reticulum membrane
activation of store-operated calcium channel activity
positive regulation of calcium ion transport into cytosol
positive regulation of intracellular protein transport
positive regulation of ryanodine-sensitive calcium-release channel activity
regulation of cardiac muscle contraction by regulation of the release of sequestered calcium ion
regulation of cell communication by electrical coupling
regulation of inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate-sensitive calcium-release channel activity
regulation of release of sequestered calcium ion into cytosol by sarcoplasmic reticulum
regulation of ryanodine-sensitive calcium-release channel activity

article.citation: Cha SH, Sekine T, Fukushima JI, Kanai Y, Kobayashi Y, Goya T, Endou H: Identification and characterization of human organic anion transporter 3 expressing predominantly in the kidney. Mol Pharmacol. 2001 May;59(5):1277-86.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier family 22 member 8
polypeptide.general-function: Sodium-independent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity
polypeptide.specific-function: Plays an important role in the excretion/detoxification of endogenous and exogenous organic anions, especially from the brain and kidney. Involved in the transport basolateral of steviol, fexofenadine. Transports benzylpenicillin (PCG), estrone-3-sulfate (E1S), cimetidine (CMD), 2,4-dichloro-phenoxyacetate (2,4-D), p-amino-hippurate (PAH), acyclovir (ACV) and ochratoxin (OTA).

go-classifier.description: sodium-independent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity

article.citation: Ventura FV, Ruiter J, Ijlst L, de Almeida IT, Wanders RJ: Differential inhibitory effect of long-chain acyl-CoA esters on succinate and glutamate transport into rat liver mitochondria and its possible implications for long-chain fatty acid oxidation defects. Mol Genet Metab. 2005 Nov;86(3):344-52. Epub 2005 Sep 19.

Mizuarai S, Miki S, Araki H, Takahashi K, Kotani H: Identification of dicarboxylate carrier Slc25a10 as malate transporter in de novo fatty acid synthesis. J Biol Chem. 2005 Sep 16;280(37):32434-41. Epub 2005 Jul 15.

polypeptide.name: Mitochondrial dicarboxylate carrier
polypeptide.specific-function: Involved in translocation of malonate, malate and succinate in exchange for phosphate, sulfate, sulfite or thiosulfate across mitochondrial inner membrane.

article.citation: Lee A, Beck L, Markovich D: The human renal sodium sulfate cotransporter (SLC13A1; hNaSi-1) cDNA and gene: organization, chromosomal localization, and functional characterization. Genomics. 2000 Dec 15;70(3):354-63.
Markovich D: Na+-sulfate cotransporter SLC13A1. Pflugers Arch. 2014 Jan;466(1):131-7. doi: 10.1007/s00424-013-1388-8. Epub 2013 Nov 6.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier family 13 member 1
polypeptide.specific-function: Sodium/sulfate cotransporter that mediates sulfate reabsorption in the kidney.

article.citation: Pajor AM: Molecular properties of the SLC13 family of dicarboxylate and sulfate transporters. Pflugers Arch. 2006 Feb;451(5):597-605. doi: 10.1007/s00424-005-1487-2. Epub 2005 Oct 7.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier family 13 member 2
polypeptide.specific-function: Cotransport of sodium ions and dicarboxylates such as succinate and citrate.

article.citation: Pajor AM: Molecular properties of the SLC13 family of dicarboxylate and sulfate transporters. Pflugers Arch. 2006 Feb;451(5):597-605. doi: 10.1007/s00424-005-1487-2. Epub 2005 Oct 7.

polypeptide.name: Solute carrier family 13 member 3
polypeptide.specific-function: High-affinity sodium-dicarboxylate cotransporter that accepts a range of substrates with 4-5 carbon atoms. The stoichiometry is probably 3 Na(+) for 1 divalent succinate.
